oracle.kubernetes.operator.watcher

Interface Watching<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the object that is being watched.

    public interface Watching<T>
    This interface is used to drive the user's watch request by call backs within an anonymous class or implemented by a named class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void eventCallback(io.kubernetes.client.util.Watch.Response<T> response)
      Call back for any watch type.
      io.kubernetes.client.util.Watch<T> initiateWatch(Object api, String resourceVersion)
      Initiate a watch operation, repeated when timed out by framework.
      boolean isStopping()
      Return true when the watch process should stop

    • Method Detail

      • initiateWatch

        io.kubernetes.client.util.Watch<T> initiateWatch(Object api,
                                                 String resourceVersion)
                                          throws io.kubernetes.client.ApiException
        Initiate a watch operation, repeated when timed out by framework.
        Parameters:
        api - Optional context object or null.
        resourceVersion - Provided resourceVersion from last event
        Returns:
        Watch object returned from API.
        Throws:
        io.kubernetes.client.ApiException - in the event of an API error.

      • eventCallback

        void eventCallback(io.kubernetes.client.util.Watch.Response<T> response)
        Call back for any watch type. This can be used instead of the specific call backs to handle any type of watch response.
        Parameters:
        response - Watch response consisting of type and object

      • isStopping

        boolean isStopping()
        Return true when the watch process should stop
        Returns:
        true, if its time to stop
